newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Red Back Mining expects to list on ASX Oct 24.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Red Back Mining expects to list on ASX Oct 24.

text.p: Nickel and gold explorer Red Back Mining NL said it expects to list on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) on October 24.
The plan to list under the ASX code RBK.AX follows an oversubscribed capital raising of A$5 million, Ross Ashton, managing director of Red Back, told Reuters.

After listing, Red Back will have acquired 100 percent equity in six projects, with an option to acquire 100 percent of a seventh, Ashton said. All of the projects are located in Western Australia, mostly an the Eastern Goldfields district.
Ashton said WMC Ltd plans to start exploration test work this week on a farm-in basis over the strike zone of the Irwin Hills nickel sulphide prospect, 90 km southeast of Laverton.
"WMC is just waiting for us to list before starting work," Ashton said.
Among its non-nickel projects, Ashton said it expects to start test drilling of the Deep Well prospect, 175 km northeast of Kalgoorlie, in about two weeks.
The project contains a measured and indicated resource of 34,700 tonnes of ore, grading 2.9 grams of gold per tonne, with untested potential over 1.1 km of strike and at depth, Ashton said.
Red Back also is getting ready to start testing of the 97 square km Balagundi prospect.
Balagundi has the potential to contain sulphide mineralisation similar to the Nimbus gold, silver and base metal deposit, eight km to the north, Ashton said.
